result.execSummary:
All charges against Rayshawn Campbell in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rayshawn Campbell is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rayshawn Campbell

11:15 AM Defendant Rayshawn Campbell in court, in custody.  Attorney Jamie M McClendon in court for Rayshawn Campbell.  Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
State moves to dismiss w/o prejudice 22CF253 and requests 22CF412 to be put on trial calendar, per ADA Rich, after further investigation State would not be able to meet its burden, victim has moved and has not had contact.
Defense received an offer 2 days ago, and needs to review with defendant.  Not asking for a trial date.
BTC: 22CF253 dismissed without prejudice.
Defense.

9:00 AM Defendant Rayshawn Campbell in court, in custody.  Attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon in court for Rayshawn Campbell.  Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Defense requests ORAL Demand for Speedy Trial on 22CF253.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. No contact with the victims D.T or A.D.T (person, property, residence or family).  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

2:02 PM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Rayshawn Campbell appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Grant Ian Henderson appeared by video for Rayshawn Campbell. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on February 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
